alert.note: Alert for Karnes (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 8:00PM CST until December 13 at 12:50AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cibolo Creek Near Falls City affecting Karnes County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cibolo Creek Near Falls City. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of crop and pastureland damages irrigation pumps and any equipment near the channel. Livestock are cut off in low areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Sunday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 18.2 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.6 feet on 12/04/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Cibolo Creek Falls City 17.0 6.4 Sun 7 pm CST 4.4 1.4 1.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 800 AM CST.
